gurmukhi: sr EG pREG pHwrYgy ] rix rMg ABIq ibhwrYgy ]
transliteration: Sar Ogh Pra-ogh Pradareeai-ge|| Rattee Ran Abheet Bihdarai-ge||
translation: There will be showers of arrows and the fighters will roam in the battlefield fearlessly.

gurmukhi: sr sUl snwhir Cu`tihgy ] idq pu`qR prw pr lu`tihgy ]341]
transliteration: Sar Sool Sanaahar(i) Chouttaih-ge|| Dit Pouttra Dharaa Par Louttaih-ge||341||
translation: The tridents and arrows will be struck and the sons of demons will roll in dust.341.

gurmukhi: sr sMk AsMkq bwhihgy ] ibnu BIq BXw dl dwhihgy ]
transliteration: Sar Sank Asankat Baahaih-ge|| Bin(u) Bheet Bhayaa Dal Daahai-ge||
translation: They will discharge arrows undoubtedly and destroy the forces of the enemy.

gurmukhi: iCq lu`Q iblu`Q ibQwrihgy ] qru sxY smUl aupwrihgy ]342]
transliteration: Chhit Loutth Biloutth Bithaariah-ge|| Tar(u) Sanai Samoond Oupaarih-ge||342||
translation: The corpses will be scattered on the earth and the great warriors will uproot the trees.342.

gurmukhi: nv nwd nPIrn bwjq By ] gl g`ij hTI rx rMg iPry ]
transliteration: Nav Naad Naphderan Baajat Bhe|| Gad Gadj(i) Hathiran Ran Phire||
translation: The musical notes of fifes were played and the persistent warriors began to roar like lions and roam in the fields.

gurmukhi: lg bwn snwh duswr kFy ] sUA q`Ck ky jm rUp mFy ]343]
transliteration: Lag Baan Sanaah Dousaar Kadhe|| Sooa Tachchhak Ke Jam Toop Madhe||343||
translation: The shafts were being taken out from quivers and the serpent-like arrows were struck like the messengers of death.343.

gurmukhi: ibnu sMk snwhir Jwrq hY ] rxbIr nvIr pRcwrq hY ]
transliteration: Bin(u) Sank Sanaahar(i) Jhaarat Hai|| Ranheer Naveer Prachaarat Hai||
translation: The warriors are spraying arrows fearlessly and are challenging one another.

gurmukhi: sr su`D islw isq Corq hY ] jIA ros hlwhl Gorq hY ]344]
transliteration: Sar Suddh Silaa Sit Chhodhat Hai|| Jeea Ros Halaabal Ghorat Hai||344||
translation: They are discharging shafts and stones and are drinking in the gearts the poison of indignation.344.

gurmukhi: rn DIr AXoDnu lu`Jq hYN ] rd pIs Blo kr ju`Jq hYN ]
transliteration: Ran Dheer Ayodhan(u) Lujjhat Hain|| Rad Pees Bhalo Kar Jujjat Hain||
translation: The conquering warriors have fought with one another in the battle and are fighting furiously.

gurmukhi: rx dyv Adyv inhwrq hYN ] jX s`d inn`id pRkwrq hYN ]345]
transliteration: Ran Dev Adev Nihaarat Hain|| Jay Sadd Ninadd(i) Poukaarat Hain||345||
translation: Both the gods and demons are viewing the battle and are raising the sound of victory.345.

gurmukhi: gx ig`Dx biR`D rVMq nBM ] iklkMq su fwkx au`c surM ]
transliteration: Gad Giddhan Briddh Radant Nabhan|| Kikant Su Daakan Ouchch Suran||
translation: The Ganas and large vultures are roaming in the sky and the vampires are shrieking violently.

gurmukhi: BRm Cwf Bkwrq BUq BUAM ] rx rMg ibhwrq BRwq dUAM ]346]
transliteration: Bhram Chhaad Bhakaarat Bhoot Bhooan|| Ran Ran Bihaarat Bhraat Dooan||346||
translation: The ghosts are laughing fearlessly and both the brother Ram and Lakshman are looking at this continued fight.346.

gurmukhi: KrdUKx mwr ibhwie dey ] jX s`d inn`d ibh`d Bey ]
transliteration: Khar-dookhan Maar Bihaae Dae|| Jay Sadd Ninadd Bihadd Bhae||
translation: Ram caused both Khar and Dushan flow down in the stream of death after killing them. The victory was greatly hailed from all the four sides.

gurmukhi: sur PUln kI brKw brKy ] rx DIr ADIr doaU prKy ]347]
transliteration: Sur Phoolan Kibarkhaa Barkhe|| Ran Dheer Adheer Dooo Parkhaa||347||
translation: The gods showered the flowers and enjoyed the sight of both the victorious warriors Ram and Lakshman.347.
